citation.article-title: Proposal of two subspecies of Fusobacterium necrophorum, (Flügge) Moore and Holdeman: Fusobacterium necrophorum subsp. necrophorum subsp. nov., nom. rev. (ex Flugge 1886), and Fusobacterium necrophorum subsp. funduliforme (ex Hallé 1898).

p.s: Description of Fusobacterium necrophorum necrophorum subsp. nov., nom. rev.

Cells grown in liquid medium are 0.5 to 0.6 by 3 to 70 μm. Filamentous forms often occur. Surface colonies on GAM agar supplemented with 5% defibrinated horse blood are about 2 mm in diameter and circular with scalloped to erose edges; they are grayish to whitish and flat (sometimes umbonate) and often have a bumpy surface. BTY broth (24) cultures produce moderate to abundant growth with homogeneous turbidity throughout the medium. Strain VPI 2891T is positive for H2S production and gelatin liquefaction and ferments maltose weakly. The hemolytic activity of these organisms is stronger than that of biovar B strains. Agglutination of chicken erythrocytes as determined by the glass slide method (2, 22) is positive, and the hemagglutination titer is more than 1:8 as determined by the test tube method (22, 24). Mice injected intraperitoneally or intraportally with strains of this subspecies die with diffuse abscesses in their livers (24).
The G+C content is 28 to 31 mol%.
The type strain of F. necrophorum subsp. necrophorum subsp. nov., nom. rev. (ex Flügge 1886), is strain VPI 2891 (= JCM 3718 = ATCC 25286).
